Posted By: Salient (1/18/2012 7:33:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think what infuriates people about this card is not that it was bad when created - a lot of cards were, and that's fine since nobody really understood the game back then - but that things like this keep coming back to waste space in future sets. Not only is Jump useless, it is directly inferior to other cards (like Leap) that ALSO won't see play in serious games since they aren't powerful enough!
  
   
Since reprinting Leap vs. Jump won't break the game, one has to conclude that cards like this are "trolls" - stuck in boosters to waste space and get some laughs at the people who buy them. I don't see how selling players trash helps them figure out that Jump is a bad card.
posts.html:
I think what infuriates people about this card is not that it was bad when created - a lot of cards were, and that's fine since nobody really understood the game back then - but that things like this keep coming back to waste space in future sets. Not only is Jump useless, it is directly inferior to other cards (like Leap) that ALSO won't see play in serious games since they aren't powerful enough!

Since reprinting Leap vs. Jump won't break the game, one has to conclude that cards like this are "trolls" - stuck in boosters to waste space and get some laughs at the people who buy them. I don't see how selling players trash helps them figure out that Jump is a bad card.
